title: Aortic Dissection Detection Risk Score (ADD-RS)
description: Rules out aortic dissection based on clinical risk factors. A guideline-based tool for identification of acute aortic dissection at initial presentation developed from the International Registry of Acute Aortic Dissection (IRAD).

parameters.name: predisposing_conditions
parameters.description: High-risk predisposing conditions for aortic dissection
parameters.notes: Includes: Marfan syndrome, family history of aortic disease, known aortic valve disease, recent aortic manipulation, or known thoracic aortic aneurysm

parameters.name: pain_features
parameters.description: High-risk pain features suggestive of aortic dissection
parameters.notes: Includes: abrupt onset of pain, severe pain intensity, or ripping/tearing pain quality

parameters.name: examination_features
parameters.description: High-risk examination features consistent with aortic dissection
parameters.notes: Includes: pulse deficit or systolic BP differential between extremities, focal neurological deficit (with pain), new murmur of aortic insufficiency (with pain), or hypotension/shock state

result.name: add_rs_score
result.description: ADD-RS score based on number of high-risk categories present

ranges.interpretation: Low risk for aortic dissection. Consider chest X-ray; if widened mediastinum present or no alternative diagnosis found, consider aortic imaging. ADD-RS captures 95.7% of aortic dissections, but 4.3% of confirmed cases had no high-risk features.

Intermediate risk for aortic dissection. Consider D-dimer testing or proceed to aortic imaging based on clinical judgment. If D-dimer available and negative (<500 ng/mL), may help rule out dissection in appropriate clinical context.

ranges.description: Two or more high-risk categories present
ranges.interpretation: High risk for aortic dissection. Proceed immediately to definitive aortic imaging (CT angiography, MRA, or TEE). Do not delay imaging for additional testing.

references: Rogers AM, Hermann LK, Booher AM, et al. Sensitivity of the aortic dissection detection risk score, a novel guideline-based tool for identification of acute aortic dissection at initial presentation: results from the International Registry of Acute Aortic Dissection. Circulation. 2011;123(20):2213-2218. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.110.988568

Hiratzka LF, Bakris GL, Beckman JA, et al. 2010 ACCF/AHA/AATS/ACR/ASA/SCA/SCAI/SIR/STS/SVM guidelines for the diagnosis and management of patients with thoracic aortic disease. Circulation. 2010;121(13):e266-e369. doi: 10.1161/CIR.0b013e3181d4739e
formula: ADD-RS Score = Number of high-risk categories present (0-3). Categories: (1) Predisposing conditions, (2) Pain features, (3) Examination features. Each category scores 0 or 1 point based on presence of any high-risk feature within that category.
notes: Based on analysis of 2538 patients with confirmed acute aortic dissection from IRAD database
95.7% sensitivity for detection of acute aortic dissection when any high-risk feature present
Designed for screening large volumes of patients at bedside
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and appropriate imaging when indicated
Not validated for specificity - may result in over-testing in low-prevalence populations
Consider D-dimer testing in intermediate-risk patients where available and appropriate
